column4: need some help- when installing ubuntu, it fails to load the live version; the x server gives me a "virtual screen too big for memory" error
specs? RAM?
is there a way to change the xorg.conf file when booting
Pentium 3 600, 256 MB RAM, SiS graphics card (8MB I belive)?
sounds OK - try booting "recover/rescue" mode - and then run dpk-reconfigure xserver-xorg at the root prompt
um dpkg-reconfigure
thanks, i'll try it out and ping you if i have more questions :) (newbie)
if you can't install from the desktop CD try the alternate CD
256MB is on the efge for the desktop CD
*edge
oh, will the alternate CD run faster?
the alternate is install only - but it uses less RAM
i.e. you can only use the alternate CD to install to the hard drive
got it. that's probably more of what i wanted, but i'll try this first
600mhz and 256MB *should* run the live CD - bt I think for installing the alternate is safer ( you might get RAM issues with the graphical installer)
is it just that the live version requires more RAM? and after i install (with either live or alternate) i'll be ok?
shoud be fine - but I strongly suggest the alternate CD for installing
ok, i'll give that a shot instead
the problem lies with the installer, not the distro as such
the graphical *installer* uses more resources
oh, yikes. got it
merry Christmas ;)
